The changes affect approximately 50 roles within the Catalogue Operations team and are not linked to AI impact or performance-related issues.

The state's Gross State Domestic Product is expected to reach approximately Rs 19.91 lakh crore. This growth outpaces India's projected GDP expansion. The review highlights significant improvements in fiscal and social indicators since 2010-11.

articles.title: Nykaa Q3 Results: Profit skyrockets 142% YoY to Rs 63 crore; revenue climbs 27%
articles.summary: Nykaa Q3 Results: Nykaa's parent company, FSN E-Commerce Ventures, reported a significant 142% surge in its December quarter net profit, reaching Rs 63 crore. Revenue from operations also saw a substantial 27% increase, climbing to Rs 2,873 crore. This strong performance was driven by a 28% year-on-year growth in gross merchandise value.

articles.title: Bharat Taxi launched: Check benefits of govt's new 'surge-free, zero commission' cab app that is 30% cheaper than rivals Ola and Uber
articles.summary: Bharat taxi launch date: India’s first cooperative-based ride-hailing platform is all set to be launced by Union Minister Amit Shah today. Operating on a zero-commission, surge-free model, it empowers drivers as "Sarathis" and owners, offering a 30% cheaper alternative to Ola and Uber while providing ₹5 lakh insurance to its 3 lakh+ registered drivers.

articles.title: White House adviser Michael Kratsios to lead US delegation to India's AI Impact Summit
articles.summary: Michael Kratsios, assistant to US President Donald Trump and director of the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy, will lead the US delegation to India's AI Impact Summit in New Delhi. The Global South's first major AI summit will focus on people-centric AI, innovation and development, alongside global policy talks and an AI expo.

articles.title: Amazon expands SVP Amit Agarwal’s role to include global selling partner services
articles.summary: The expansion of Agarwal’s role follows the appointment of Dharmesh Mehta, vice president of worldwide selling partner services as a technical adviser (TA) to Jassy.

articles.title: Telegram's Durov says proposed Spanish social media restrictions seek to censor critics
articles.summary: Durov said in a message on Telegram to users that Spain's proposed legislative ‌package would force ‌social media platforms to gather data on all users, and its measures to curb hate speech would prompt platforms to strip content to avoid prosecution.

articles.title: AI founders taking O-1 visa route to get to US and build
articles.summary: The US O-1 visa, for individuals with exceptional skills, is increasingly becoming popular among Indian AI founders moving to the US. Unlike the capped H-1B, O-1 offers faster approvals, employer flexibility, and a quicker EB-1A green card route. Demand is rising despite tighter scrutiny and more requests for evidence.

articles.title: Foreign cloud companies will get 20-year tax rebate, but conditions apply
articles.summary: Foreign cloud providers in India will receive a 20-year tax exemption on global income if they use notified Indian data centres and sell via local resellers. Domestic profits remain taxable, with a 15% safe-harbour for related entities. The move aims to boost investment in India’s data centre infrastructure.

articles.title: Open to import of Venezuelan oil based on viability: MEA
articles.summary: India prioritizes energy security for its vast population. The government's strategy focuses on diversifying energy sources based on market conditions and global dynamics. India maintains open options for crude oil imports from Venezuela and other regions, considering commercial viability. Energy engagement with Venezuela has a long history, with crude purchases resuming in 2023-24 after a pause.

articles.title: Import norms eased for certified foreign vehicles
articles.summary: India is easing import rules for foreign vehicles. A select number of certified cars and motorcycles can now enter without prototype testing. This move aims to simplify imports, especially for European models, following a trade deal. Importers will need compliance certificates. Specific emission reports are also required for certain vehicles.

articles.title: Spending capacity of ministries in focus as fund offtake falters
articles.summary: Indian govt spending: To be sure, most of these savings have been redeployed in other programmes, and the central government's overall expenditure for the current fiscal is just ₹1 lakh crore lower than the initial target of ₹50.65 lakh crore.

articles.title: Govt restricts platinum article import, umbrellas
articles.summary: India has restricted imports of certain platinum articles to combat illicit gold smuggling, following a surge in such imports. This move aims to close a loophole exploited by importers. In a separate development, the government has also placed restrictions on umbrella imports, setting a minimum price to bolster domestic production.

articles.title: Bengal budget size in FY'27 crosses Rs 4 lakh cr, fiscal indicators improve: Amit Mitra
articles.summary: West Bengal's economy has expanded significantly over the last decade. The budget outlay has reached a record high of over Rs 4 lakh crore. State tax collection has risen substantially, and nominal Gross State Domestic Product is projected to grow. Capital expenditure has seen a massive increase, with a focus on asset creation.

articles.title: India exports first fuel to Europe since ban on Russian crude-derived products
articles.summary: India has begun exporting jet fuel to Europe again. Reliance Industries sent a cargo to Italy after a European Union ban on Russian oil products. This move follows India's increased purchases of discounted Russian crude. Reliance assures European buyers that Russian crude is not used for these exports.

articles.title: India's sunflower oil imports to slide to four-year low on price premium
articles.summary: India's sunflower oil imports are set to fall next year. Higher prices are pushing buyers towards cheaper alternatives like palm oil. This shift could help reduce global palm oil stockpiles. Importers anticipate bringing in only enough sunflower oil for essential needs. Palm oil imports saw a substantial rise in January, while sunflower oil imports decreased.

articles.title: India sets sail to add more trade muscle as it signs FTA terms with Gulf Cooperation Council
articles.summary: India and the Gulf Cooperation Council have signed the terms of reference for a free trade agreement. This move restarts negotiations for a pact that has been pending since 2004. Talks had previously paused in 2011. The signing on Thursday sets the stage for defining the scope and framework of the trade deal between India and the GCC nations.

articles.title: Economically weak nations not taken seriously on world stage: Ex NITI Aayog member
articles.summary: NITI Aayog ex-vice-chair Rajiv Kumar emphasizes that a strong economy is the bedrock of India's foreign policy. He states that India must accelerate its economic growth and boost its share in global trade to command respect internationally. Kumar highlights China's economic rise as a model for global influence.

articles.title: RBI MPC 2026: Central bank to keep repo rate unchanged amid currency volatility and bond yield pressures, as per SBI report
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India's Monetary Policy Committee is expected to hold interest rates steady. Global economic uncertainty and domestic bond yield pressures are key factors. Recent trade deals with the EU and US offer export support. However, lingering global risks and commodity price shifts add complexity. Inflation signals are mixed, leading to a cautious approach by the RBI.

articles.title: India must boost capital markets so Indians grow with economy: Larry Fink, chief executive, BlackRock
articles.summary: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink urges India to prioritize domestic capital markets over foreign inflows for sustained economic participation. He highlights India's advanced financial infrastructure, from digital payments to asset tokenization, as a strong foundation for growth. Fink also downplayed AI bubble concerns, emphasizing underinvestment risks, especially in the US, amidst China's progress.

articles.title: US-India trade deal: India won't be bullied by Trump and his aides, Ajit Doval told Rubio
articles.summary: India's national security advisor met with US officials to mend ties after President Trump's tariffs and criticism. This led to a trade agreement reducing tariffs and boosting US imports, signaling a thaw in relations despite India's strategic autonomy efforts.

articles.title: India-US trade deal to boost renewable exports, strengthen supply chains, say RE players
articles.summary: Indian renewable energy players welcome the India-US trade deal. They believe it will restore stability in global trade and strengthen supply chains. The improved tariff environment will boost export competitiveness for Indian businesses. This move is seen as significant for the solar sector, enhancing price competitiveness and market access to the US.

articles.title: Kremlin shrugs off India’s oil diversification move
articles.summary: India plans to diversify its energy sources to ensure citizen security. Russia's Kremlin stated this is not new, as India has always sourced oil from various nations, including Russia. This comes after a US-India trade deal announcement. Russia acknowledges India's established practice of buying oil from multiple international suppliers.

articles.title: India-US trade deal redraws the playbook for Indian exporters
articles.summary: A surprise US tariff cut by President Donald Trump has reshaped plans for Indian exporters. Garment makers are halting overseas moves and reopening price talks with American buyers. This shift means discounts will end, leading to revised invoices or upcharges. While some sectors welcome the move, others find it too late for current orders.

articles.title: Trade deal with US aligns with India's manufacturing ambitions, report shows
articles.summary: A new India-US trade deal is set to boost India's manufacturing and exports. This agreement helps India diversify its trade and climb global value chains. For the US, India offers a large market and manufacturing options. The deal is expected to improve India's growth and financial stability. Export-focused sectors will benefit from better market access and certainty.

articles.title: India-US trade deal will protect farmers' interests & sensitive sectors: Piyush Goyal elaborates pact in Lok Sabha
articles.summary: India and the United States have finalized a trade agreement. This pact aims to boost Indian exports and support Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises. Farmers' interests and sensitive sectors are safeguarded. The deal is expected to strengthen India-US relations and promote initiatives like 'Make in India'.

articles.title: Stockbrokers' body urges FM Sitharaman to revoke securities transaction tax hike proposal
articles.summary: A body of stockbrokers on Thursday urged Finance Minister Nirmal Sitharaman to revoke the budget proposal to hike the securities transaction tax.

articles.title: India monitoring evolving crypto trading to ensure tax compliance, top tax official says
articles.summary: India is talking to cryptocurrency exchanges ‍to assess evolving ​trading activity as it seeks oversight over newer ⁠crypto products, according to a top tax official.

articles.title: Tata Steel Q3 Preview: PAT may soar 5x YoY as volumes lift earnings
articles.summary: Brokerages expect Tata Steel to post Q3 results, with volumes offsetting weak steel prices and higher costs. Revenue may rise 8% year on year, while profit is seen jumping sharply on operating leverage and improved India and overseas performance.

articles.title: Gainers & Losers: Suzlon Energy, Nykaa among 6 stocks in focus on Thursday
articles.summary: Indian markets snapped a winning streak as Sensex and Nifty fell amid broad selling. Financials, auto and IT lagged, while stock-specific moves followed earnings.

articles.title: Bharti Airtel’s Q3 profit falls 55% YoY on one-time labour code provision
articles.summary: Bharti Airtel’s Q3 profit fell 55% YoY to Rs 6,630.5 crore due to a one-time labour code provision, though underlying profit rose sequentially. Consolidated revenue grew nearly 20% to Rs 53,982 crore, driven by strong India operations and robust Africa growth. ARPU climbed to Rs 259, the sector’s highest.

articles.title: Knowledge Realty Trust Q3 NOI rises 19% YoY to Rs 1,041 crore
articles.summary: Knowledge Realty Trust reported a strong Q3 performance, with net operating income rising 19% YoY to Rs 1,040.7 crore and revenue up 21%. Leasing momentum remained firm with 0.6 million sq ft added, while occupancy stood at 92%. The REIT also reduced its cost of debt and declared Rs 695.3 crore in distributions.

articles.title: LIC Q3 Results: Cons PAT jumps 17% YoY to Rs 12,930 crore, net premium income also up 17%
articles.summary: LIC Q3 Results: LIC reported a 17% YoY rise in Q3 consolidated profit to Rs 12,930 crore, supported by higher premium income and improved VNB margins. Despite a slight dip in policy sales, APE, solvency ratio and AUM all strengthened, while non-par products and overall profitability saw robust growth.

articles.title: Tata Motors PV Q3 Results: Co reports loss of Rs 3,486 crore; revenue falls 26%
articles.summary: Tata Motors PV Q3 Results: Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles Ltd reported a consolidated loss of Rs 3,486 crore in the third quarter, compared with the profit of Rs 5,406 crore in the year-ago period. Revenue from operations fell 26% year-on-year (YoY) to Rs 70,108 crore.

articles.title: Rupee edges up on modest inflows; importer hedging curbs gains
articles.summary: The Indian ‍rupee ended modestly higher on ​Thursday, shored up by foreign banks' dollar sales and ⁠traders cutting intraday short bets while companies' demand to hedge their dollar exposures kept a lid on gains.

articles.title: Retail investors bet big on these 11 small-caps, 5 turn multibaggers
articles.summary: Retail investors boosted stakes in 386 small-caps for two quarters, with 11 stocks—including Sri Adhikari Brothers, SML Mahindra and TD Power Systems—surging 50–370% and five turning multibaggers.

articles.title: Hindustan Copper Q3 Results: Cons PAT soars 149% YoY to Rs 156 crore; interim dividend declared
articles.summary: ​​​​Hindustan Copper Q3 Results: Hindustan Copper reported a 149% YoY jump in Q3 net profit to Rs 156 crore, with revenue doubling to Rs 687 crore. Sequentially, profit dipped 16% on softer topline. The company declared a Re 1 interim dividend with February 13 as the record date for the payout.

articles.title: IOC Q3 results: Profit jumps over 4x YoY to Rs 12,126 crore; revenue rises 7%
articles.summary: Indian Oil Corporation reported a strong rebound in Q3FY26, with profit after tax surging over four-fold to Rs 12,126 crore, aided by higher refining margins and improved operations. Revenue rose 7% to Rs 2.31 lakh crore, driven by petroleum products, petrochemicals, and gas, highlighting a sharp turnaround from last year’s muted earnings.

articles.title: Sensex tumbles 504 pts, Nifty snaps 3-day gaining streak. 5 triggers behind the decline
articles.summary: Benchmark indices halted a three-day winning streak on Thursday as Nifty and Sensex slipped amid a broad market selloff. Metals, global tech weakness, profit booking, caution ahead of the RBI policy, and Sensex expiry dragged sentiment, with smallcaps and midcaps also ending lower.

articles.title: UNO Minda Q3 Results: Net profit rises 18% YoY to Rs 300 crore
articles.summary: Auto components maker UNO Minda Ltd on Thursday reported an 18.13 per cent rise in consolidated net profit at Rs 300.48 crore in the third quarter ended December 31, 2025, riding on robust sales.

articles.title: Buy stocks or follow grandmother's wisdom of investing in gold? What BlackRock CEO said
articles.summary: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink said gold remains a reliable diversifier but argued that long-term wealth creation lies in Indian equities, which he believes could double or triple over the next two decades. While acknowledging “grandmother’s wisdom” behind gold buying, he noted that investing in equities supports India’s economic growth in a way gold cannot.

articles.title: AI disrupts Indian IT: Why TCS & Infosys face pain while niche players surge
articles.summary: India's top IT companies are not leading the AI revolution. Market expert Sudip Bandyopadhyay warns of restructuring and margin pressure for giants like TCS and Infosys. Newer, specialized IT firms are succeeding by focusing on high-growth areas like travel and electric vehicles. Investors should look to these niche players for future growth opportunities.

articles.title: Suzlon Energy Q3 Results: Cons PAT rises 15% YoY to Rs 445 crore; revenue zooms 42%
articles.summary: Suzlon Energy Q3 Results: Suzlon Energy reported a 15% year-on-year profit increase to Rs 445 crore for the December quarter, with revenue soaring 42% to Rs 4,228 crore. The company achieved a record orderbook of 6.4 GW and highlighted a strong domestic demand outlook for renewables, projecting wind energy to significantly outpace overall power growth.

articles.title: Godrej Properties Q3 Results: Profit rises 23% YoY to Rs 194 crore
articles.summary: Realty firm Godrej Properties Ltd on Thursday reported a 23 per cent increase in its consolidated net profit to Rs 193.87 crore for the quarter ended December despite lower income.

articles.title: Blackstone appoints bankers for Piramal Glass IPO
articles.summary: Blackstone is preparing PGP Glass for a public listing. Axis Capital, Bank of America, and HSBC are appointed as lead bankers. The company aims to raise between $400 million and $500 million. PGP Glass is a global specialist in glass packaging solutions. It serves customers in cosmetics, spirits, and pharmaceuticals. The company has operations in India and Sri Lanka.

articles.title: Bharti Airtel Q3 Results Today Live Updates: Profit down 55% YoY to Rs 6,630 crore; ARPU rises to Rs 259
HAL shares fall 12% in 2 days, PSU clarifies on Tejas fighter jets and guidance
articles.summary: HAL shares fell sharply, extending a sharp two-day decline, after concerns over Tejas Mk1A delivery delays and rising private-sector competition triggered investor anxiety. The company issued a clarification, confirming five jets are ready while nine await GE engines, and reaffirmed its full-year guidance despite losing ground in India’s AMCA program.

articles.title: Wait-and-watch in IT, look at autos, textiles, infra: Anand Rathi’s Narendra Solanki maps next market winners
articles.summary: India's IT sector faces AI disruption, prompting caution from analysts. Meanwhile, textiles are surging on trade deal hopes, autos show sustained growth driven by government support, and infrastructure offers compelling value. Investors are advised to wait for clarity in IT, be selective in autos, and watch textiles closely for better entry points.

articles.title: Nykaa Q3 delivers big; AI capex hots up
articles.summary: Nykaa posts strong Q3 results as profits and revenue surge. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: Fashion quick commerce startup Zilo raises $15.3 million led by Peak XV Partners
articles.summary: The funding round also saw participation from angel investors including Groww founder and CEO Lalit Keshre, Cred founder Kunal Shah and Ayyappan R, founder of FirstClub. Founded in February last year by Padmakumar Pal and Bhavik Jhaveri, Zilo has already raised nearly $20 million in funding.

articles.title: I praise India for having assumed leadership for AI Impact Summit: UN chief Guterres
articles.summary: Secretary General Guterres will be travelling to India to attend the India-AI Impact Summit 2026 that will be held on February 19-20 in New Delhi.

articles.title: O-1 visa gains ground; Anthropic triggers IT crash
articles.summary: Happy Thursday! Indian AI founders are turning to the US O-1 visa as a faster, more flexible way to move and scale their businesses. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

articles.title: Interior decor startup Material Depot raises $10 million from Accel, Stellaris Venture Partners
articles.summary: Whiteboard Capital, DeVC, Soma Capital, and MyAsiaVC, along with angel investors including Livspace founder Ramakant Sharma, Curefoods founder Ankit Nagori, BharatPe cofounder Shashvat Nakrani, Spinny founder Niraj Singh, and Tracxn founder Abhishek Goyal, among others, participated. The fresh capital will be used to strengthen the company’s tech stack, expand its product portfolio and collections, and scale its offline presence across cities.

articles.title: ASI has 3,686 protected sites; none missing at present Government tells Parliament
articles.summary: The government has told Parliament that all centrally protected monuments under the Archaeological Survey of India are currently traceable, even as it acknowledged instances of unauthorised construction around several heritage sites and said enforcement action has been taken under the AMASR Act.

articles.title: No country is AI-ready: Pearson CEO flags skill gaps in India, warns of vocational shortage
articles.summary: India and other major economies face deep-rooted workforce challenges as artificial intelligence accelerates, with Pearson Global CEO Omar Abbosh warning that shortages in vocational skills and educator preparedness could slow inclusive AI adoption.

articles.title: Mad Over Donuts initiates minority stake sale amid flurry of dessert deals
articles.summary: Gourmet doughnut chain Mad Over Donuts explores private equity investment with teasers having been sent to prospective suitors amid deal buzz in India’s QSR and dessert segment.

articles.title: Over 3,800 Indian nationals deported from US in 2025: Government tells Parliament
articles.summary: Over 3,800 Indian nationals were deported from the US in 2025, the government informed the Rajya Sabha on Thursday.

articles.title: Apple begins hiring for retail roles in Hyderabad
articles.summary: Apple has issued a job notification seeking outlet managers and retail managers, among other roles, to be based here, sparking speculation that the iPhone maker may open a retail store in the city.

articles.title: Finance Commission hearings expose deep Centre–states rift over tax devolution, cess sharing
articles.summary: With most states arguing that rising cess and surcharge collections have eroded the shareable tax pool, the Finance Commission hearings have become a forum for deeper questions on fiscal autonomy, constitutional limits, and how India’s federal finances should be recalibrated amid mounting spending pressures.

articles.title: How global companies are quietly turning India into their second home
articles.summary: Global capability centres are reshaping India’s office market, jobs and capital flows, turning the country into a long-term hub for high-value global work and growth.

articles.title: What will India buy from the US for $500 billion? Piyush Goyal answers
articles.summary: The Modi administration has been faced with the big question ever since India promised to buy American products, as part of the tariff truce with the Trump administration.

articles.title: RBI policy expectations: Rate pause likely in February, focus shifts to liquidity moves
articles.summary: RBI Policy expectations: Most economists polled by CNBC-TV18 expect a rate pause through 2026. The central bank is likely to use liquidity tools to manage bond yields and funding conditions while keeping macro forecasts steady ahead of new data series.

articles.title: India-US trade deal lifts market mood, industry sees relief for key export sectors
articles.summary: Industry leaders Rajiv Memani, Amit Kalyani, Sanjay Budhia and Suvankar Sen welcome the India-US trade deal, citing tariff relief and improved export prospects.

articles.title: India-US Trade Deal | Dairy, agriculture protected, says Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: Piyush Goyal announced that India protected dairy and agriculture in the US-India trade deal, with tariffs cut to 18%, benefiting marine exporters, MSMEs, and technology sectors.

articles.title: FICCI leaders welcome India-US trade deal, say tariff cut lifts uncertainty and opens export opportunities
articles.summary: FICCI leaders said the sharp reduction in US tariffs on Indian goods could provide a major boost to export-oriented sectors, improve India’s competitiveness against rival economies, and strengthen long-term trade ties with the world’s largest consumer market, even as the fine print of the agreement is awaited.

articles.title: US-India trade agreement: How India’s Russian crude oil imports could change
articles.summary: India and the United States agreed to cut US tariffs on Indian goods to 18% and lift levies linked to Russian crude, but India has not formally committed to ending Russian oil imports. Let's take a look at what the deal could mean for Russian crude imports.

articles.title: India gains cost edge as US tariff reset opens door for supply chain shift, say experts
articles.summary: The India-US tariff deal is expected to support foreign investor sentiment, improve earnings visibility, and strengthen India’s role in global supply chains. Market experts say the agreement could help attract investment into manufacturing and technology-linked sectors, while future FII flows may depend on currency stability and policy signals.

articles.title: India-US Trade Deal: Industry leaders welcome Modi-Trump trade agreement
articles.summary: India and the US announced a trade deal under which Washington will reduce the reciprocal tariff on Indian goods from 25% to 18%. Prime Minister Narendra Modi welcomed the move, saying it will benefit “Made in India” products and unlock opportunities for mutual cooperation. Business and government leaders, including Ashwini Vaishnaw, Piyush Goyal, Kumar Mangalam Birla, and Dr Sanjiv Goenka, called the deal a “win-win” for citizens, industries, and supply chains.

articles.title: US-India trade deal removes tariff overhang, clears air for investors: Nisha Biswal
articles.summary: Nisha Biswal of the Asia Group said the interim US-India trade pact has eased tensions in the bilateral economic relationship and reduced uncertainty for businesses and investors. While key tariff cuts have been announced, she noted that several details remain under negotiation and more clarity is expected in the coming days.

articles.title: India-US trade deal announced; Tariff on exports drops to 18% from 50%
articles.summary: Earlier in the day, Commerce Secretary Rajesh Agarwal also told CNBC-TV18 that a lot of the "sticky issues" with regards to the deal have been addressed and that there is a lot of convergence between the two countries on addressing the reciprocal tariff issue.

articles.title: Mumbai court clears DHFL, now Piramal Finance, in ₹5,050 crore money laundering case
articles.summary: A Mumbai special PMLA court discharged DHFL, now Piramal Finance, in a ₹5,050 crore money laundering case, granting immunity under Section 32A of the IBC after its takeover through insolvency.

articles.title: KNR Constructions' poor form continues; Q3 net profit, revenue, margins weaken
articles.summary: KNR Constructions' net profit plunged 58.7% to ₹102.8 crore for Q3 of the current financial year, down from ₹248.6 crore in the year-ago period. The firm won a ₹319.24-crore project during the quarter; shares closed lower at ₹148.85.

articles.title: Inside the Leap to Unicorn Top 100: The startups shaping India's next decade
articles.summary: How Leap to Unicorn is building one of India's most credible discovery pipelines for early stage ventures.

articles.title: Dhurandhar powers PVR INOX to best post-pandemic footfalls; film contributes 30% of Q3 box office
articles.summary: The late-quarter surge from Dhurandhar helped PVR INOX offset a weak festive slate, pushing cinema footfalls to their highest level since Covid and highlighting how breakout content can still decisively lift multiplex performance.

articles.title: HAL dismisses delay claims, says fighter jet project won't hit growth
articles.summary: DK Sunil, Chairman and Managing Director of Hindustan Aeronautics Limited, said that even in a worst-case scenario, the AMCA programme does not impact HAL’s near- or medium-term financial outlook. He noted that since production is expected only around 2035, revenues from AMCA have never been included in the company’s current business plans.

articles.title: Andhra Pradesh sanctions over ₹500 crore to acquire 2,000 acres of land for port, ship building cluster
articles.summary: In Tirupati district, 251 acres have been identified for acquisition in Pathetipalem village, followed by Vagarru (530 acres), Valamedu (724 acres) and Pamanji (489 acres), totalling 1,995 acres. Likewise, 176 acres have been identified in Nellore's Kota mandal -- 46 acres in Kothapatnam village and 129 acres in Puchalapalli.

articles.title: Eicher delivers 13.5m electric sleeper bus for intercity routes; 35 by March 2026
articles.summary: Eicher Trucks & Buses has delivered its first 13.5m electric intercity sleeper coach, with 35 buses set for North India routes by March 2026 through operator LeafyBus.

articles.title: Race for RCB: Dr Ranjan Pai, Adar Poonawalla, EQT, Premji Invest submit non-binding bids
articles.summary: Private equity giant Blackstone is also planning to submit a potential non-binding bid, but no final decision has been taken, sources said

articles.title: Cognizant to roll out 100% bonus pay after hitting growth targets ahead of plan
articles.summary: Cognizant’s entry into the 'Winner’s Circle' followed 6.4% year-on-year constant currency growth in 2025, the highest among large IT services firms.

articles.title: Astral Q3 Results: Net profit dips 5.5% to ₹108 crore despite 10% revenue growth
articles.summary: Astral Ltd Q3 net profit fell 5.5% at ₹107.7 crore, but revenue rose 10.3% at ₹1,541.5 crore. Q2 saw strong profit growth and set a solid base for Q3 performance.

articles.title: Hitachi Energy India Q3 Results: Profit jumps 90% YoY as orders surge; margin expand sharply
articles.summary: Hitachi Energy India posted a strong Q3 with profit nearly doubling, revenue up 29% YoY and margins expanding, supported by robust order inflows and electrification-led demand.

articles.title: Bharti Airtel Q3 Results: Revenue and EBITDA grow QoQ as ARPU rises; profit softens
articles.summary: Bharti Airtel posted steady Q3 growth with revenues and EBITDA rising sequentially, driven by higher ARPU, strong Homes additions and Africa performance, even as net profit eased marginally.

articles.title: Panacea Biotec shares fall after Hungary flags quality issues at Baddi unit
articles.summary: All GMP certificates issued by NCPHP revoked; corrective actions underway, EU exports form 0.32% of Panacea Biotec Limited’s revenue

articles.title: Berger Paints Q3: Volumes jump over 8%, profit declines as scale, brand spends weigh
articles.summary: Berger Paints posted flat revenue and an 8% YoY profit decline in Q3, offset by strong volume growth, record gross margins and management optimism on improving demand trends.

articles.title: RVNL Q3 Results: Low-single-digit revenue growth from last year, margins narrow further
articles.summary: RVNL's EBITDA margin for the period narrowed by 50 basis points year-on-year to 4.7% from 5.2% earlier. The stock is down over 50% from its August 2024-peak of ₹647.

articles.title: QSR recovery signs emerge but dine-in demand still weak: Elara Capital lists stocks to watch
articles.summary: Karan Taurani, EVP at Elara Capital, said companies with higher delivery share are expected to perform better, while merger-led cost synergies may support margins for some players.

articles.title: J Kumar Infraprojects sees weaker Q3 after monsoon disruptions
articles.summary: Net profit falls 17.2% to ₹82.8 crore; revenue, EBITDA and margins also see moderation

articles.title: Max Healthcare Q3 Results: Revenue up 9% YoY; occupancy dips, ARPOB rises 3%
articles.summary: Max Healthcare reported slower Q3 revenue growth with softer occupancy and margins, though higher ARPOB and steady profit growth reflected resilience amid operational and regulatory headwinds.

articles.title: Hindustan Copper Q3 Results: Higher prices aid topline growth, margins expand
articles.summary: Hindustan Copper's financial performance during the quarter was aided by a rally in Copper prices in the global markets. Prices have now dipped below the mark of $13,000 mark, with stockpiles and China demand in focus.

articles.title: Varroc Engineering Q3 Results: Loss narrows, revenue up 10%; shares slip post earnings
articles.summary: Varroc Engineering reported a sharply lower Q3 loss on improved revenue and EBITDA, though the stock fell as margins stayed flat and a labour code provision weighed on performance.

articles.title: Sell silver on any rise, bull run is over for now, says Kunal Shah of Nirmal Bang
articles.summary: Kunal Shah, Vice President and Head of Commodities Research at Nirmal Bang Securities, said the recent 40% crash has effectively ended the bull run in silver and flagged rising demand destruction from the industrial sector—where users are increasingly replacing silver with cheaper alternatives such as copper—as a key reason for his bearish view.

articles.title: Page Industries Q3 Results: Stock jumps after steady operating performance; Dividend announced
articles.summary: Sales volumes for Page Industries in Q3 grew by 1.4% from last year to 58.6 million pieces. The company said that the new launches made by them have received a healthy response and it positions themselves well to accelerate growth.

articles.title: Dredging Corp Q3 Results: PSU stock tanks as profit turns into loss; margin narrows sharply
articles.summary: Dredging Corporation slipped into a Q3 net loss as revenue and operating profit fell sharply year-on-year, triggering a steep sell-off in the PSU stock on Dalal Street.

articles.title: PFC Q3 Results: Core income growth of 19%; Asset quality improves, dividend declared
articles.summary: The board of PFC also approved an interim dividend of ₹4 per share, the record date for which has been fixed as Friday, February 20, 2026.

articles.title: Yatharth Hospitals Q3 Results: Profit jumps 49% as new hospitals fuel growth; ARPOB up 10%
articles.summary: Yatharth Hospitals posted a strong Q3, with profit up 49% and revenue rising 46% YoY, led by rapid scale-up at newly commissioned facilities and sustained momentum at existing hospitals.

articles.title: Alembic Pharma Q3 Results: Topline up 11%, margins hold; India, US markets post 6% growth
articles.summary: Alembic Pharmaceuticals posted double-digit revenue growth in Q3, with margins steady, though a one-time labour code provision weighed on net profit despite strong global execution.

articles.title: Indian Oil Q3 Results: Strong operating performance leads to gains for the PSU stock
articles.summary: Courtesy of the strong operating performance during the December quarter, shares of Indian Oil Corporation gained on Thursday. The stock is up 40% in the last 12 months.

articles.title: SAMRIDH Scheme Disbursed INR 94 Cr Startup Funding In 5 Years: MoS IT
articles.summary: Minister of State (MoS) for IT Jitin Prasada yesterday informed the Parliament that the Centre has disbursed funds worth INR

articles.title: Fibr AI Raises $5.7 Mn To Strengthen Agentic AI-Powered Martech Stack
articles.summary: AI-native martech startup Fibr AI has raised $5.7 Mn (about INR 52 Cr) in a seed funding round led by

articles.title: A Wellness Buyout: What Makes Cosmix A High-Conviction Bet For Marico?
articles.summary: FMCG major Marico today announced the acquisition of Bengaluru-based plant-based protein startup Cosmix Wellness, marking its second takeover deal in

articles.title: You may donate online via danamojo.
Organisational Policies
India Semiconductor Mission 2.0 to ensure long-term policy stability, says MeitY Secretary
articles.summary: The Government of India plans to sustain the growth of the domestic semiconductor industry through the upcoming launch of the India Semiconductor Mission (ISM) 2.0.

articles.title: Govt eyeing 25,000 more GPUs as AI Mission’s fourth tender closes
articles.summary: The government expects to add close to 25,000 graphics processing units (GPUs) in the next few weeks to the existing commitments for 40,535 GPUs, a senior government official told ET, as the fourth round of GPU procurement is underway and is expected to close soon.

articles.title: TSMC fabricated seven chips, including 12nm under DLI
articles.summary: Seven chip designs made by startups under the design-linked incentive (DLI) scheme for semiconductors have been successfully fabricated, including advanced nodes such as 12 nanometres (nm) by global majors like Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co, the government told the Lok Sabha Wednesday.

articles.title: Ride-hailing gig worker unions call for strike on February 7
articles.summary: A group of unions representing gig workers operating with ride-hailing companies like Uber, Ola and Rapido have called for a strike on Saturday, February 7.

articles.title: Uber appoints Indian-origin Balaji Krishnamurthy as CFO
articles.summary: Krishnamurthy replaces Prashanth Mahendra-Rajah, of Sri Lankan origin. Uber's CTO Praveen Naga, CPO Sachin Kansal, and global head of mobility Pradeep Parameswaran are also Indians.

articles.title: Account aggregators power 71% surge in loan disbursements
articles.summary: Loan disbursements facilitated by account aggregators (AAs) reached Rs 24,000 crore in the first half of FY26, up 71% from H1FY25, said Sahamati, an industry alliance of NBFC AAs.

articles.title: Union minister Amit Shah to launch India's first cooperative-sector taxi service Bharat Taxi
articles.summary: Bharat Taxi is India's first cooperative ride-hailing platform. This initiative empowers drivers, offering them ownership and fair value. Bharat Taxi operates on a zero-commission, surge-free model, directly distributing profits to drivers.

articles.title: Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Delhi lead investment in premium office spaces: NTT DATA
articles.summary: India’s GCCs continue to grow, with Bengaluru, Hyderabad, and Delhi NCR attracting premium office and residential investments. Expansion is also reaching tier II and III cities, driven by lower costs and better quality of life for employees. However, talent scarcity, AI adoption gaps, and cyber risks remain key challenges for sustained growth.

articles.title: Odisha hosts Black Swan summit to boost AI-led digital growth
articles.summary: Bhubaneswar is set to host the Black Swan Summit India, a significant two-day conference on AI, FinTech, and InsurTech. President Droupadi Murmu and Odisha Chief Minister Mohan Charan Majhi will attend the event. The summit aims to position Odisha as a key player in India's digital growth.

articles.title: Private funds assess AI better than public investors: Fractal Analytics CEO on discounted IPO pricing
articles.summary: Fractal Analytics, which is expected to be the first pureplay Indian artificial intelligence (AI) company to tap the country’s public markets, has priced its initial public offering (IPO) at about a 26% discount to its most recent private market valuation.

articles.title: Uber misses on profit outlook, names new CFO for robotaxi future
articles.summary: The executive, Balaji Krishnamurthy, has been with Uber for more than six years and is currently vice president of strategic finance and investor relations. He will replace current CFO Prashanth Mahendra-Rajah, who is leaving for another opportunity after less than three years at the company, according to a regulatory filing published Wednesday. The outgoing CFO will step down from his post on Feb. 16 and stay on as a senior finance adviser through July 1, the filing said.

articles.title: BIF, ICEA flags risks in fast-tracking data protection rollout, urges MeitY to retain phased timelines
articles.summary: Industry bodies BIF and ICEA have asked the government not to rush the rollout of India’s data protection rules. They warned that faster timelines could disrupt businesses and weaken compliance. A phased, consultative approach, they said, is key to regulatory certainty and effective implementation.

articles.title: Partners earn on par with IT freshers, top performers make over Rs 51,000 a month: Urban Company
articles.summary: Urban Company said its service partners earned higher average monthly incomes this year compared to last, despite growing unrest in the gig economy. The company highlighted steady demand, insurance cover, and pension access as signs of improved work conditions. The data contrasts with recent strikes demanding better pay and worker recognition.

articles.title: Govt borrowing of Rs 17.2 lakh cr to be completed in non-disruptive manner: DEA Secy
articles.summary: Govt borrowing: The government had estimated a gross borrowing Budget of Rs 14.61 lakh crore in FY26 against the budget estimate of Rs 14.82 lakh crore.

articles.title: Farmers now getting loans in 5 minutes through e-KCC: Adityanath
articles.summary: Yogi Adityanath said the cooperative sector has also undergone major reforms under the vision of "Sahkar se Samriddhi", with digitisation, e-governance and transparent policies ensuring accountability.

articles.title: Indian lenders ask RBI to ease liquidity rules before policy meeting, sources say
articles.summary: Indian banks are asking the Reserve Bank of India for regulatory changes. They face a deposit shortfall and rising bond yields. Lenders want a delay in liquidity coverage ratio norms. They also seek flexibility in shifting bonds and want cash reserve ratio to count as high-quality liquid assets. These requests aim to ease funding pressures.

articles.title: India and Gulf Cooperation Council to ink fresh terms for FTA talks today
articles.summary: India and the Gulf Cooperation Council are set to sign terms for a free trade agreement. This marks a significant step towards a comprehensive trade pact. The agreement aims to boost bilateral trade between India and the GCC bloc. This development follows recent trade deals with the US and EU.

articles.title: Strong demand lifts services PMI in Jan
articles.summary: India's services sector showed strong growth in January. New orders and output increased, boosting activity. Manufacturing also saw gains. This positive trend signals sustained momentum. Businesses are optimistic about the future. Hiring resumed, though at a modest pace. Input and output prices rose moderately. Service providers are managing costs effectively.

articles.title: India, Gulf Cooperation Council to ink terms of reference on Feb 5 for starting FTA talks
articles.summary: India and the six-nation Gulf Cooperation Council bloc will sign terms of reference for free trade agreement talks. This marks a resumption of negotiations after earlier rounds in 2006 and 2008. The agreement aims to boost trade between India and countries like Saudi Arabia, UAE, Qatar, Kuwait, Oman, and Bahrain.

articles.title: NHAI to create a pool of skilled construction workers
articles.summary: The plan is to partner with the construction companies to impart skills training through ITIs with the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) providing the seed funding and the companies sharing the cost of training through the corporate social responsibility fund.

articles.title: Amazon ties up with IIT Roorkee to develop packaging material from agri waste
articles.summary: Amazon India is partnering with IIT Roorkee to create new packaging materials. These will be made from agricultural waste, offering a sustainable alternative to wood pulp and plastic. The project aims to develop lightweight, strong, and compostable mailers. This initiative could also benefit farmers by creating a market for their crop residues.

articles.title: CBDT chief says 88 per cent of individual taxpayers have opted for new tax regime
articles.summary: A significant 88% of individual taxpayers have opted for the new tax regime, with the government not planning a sunset clause for the old regime. The new regime offers lower tax rates and exemptions for those earning up to Rs 15 lakh annually. The Budget also proposes changes to MAT and STT to influence taxpayer behavior.

articles.title: How India is likely to shield its farmers in US trade deal
articles.summary: India and the US have reached a trade agreement, with the US reducing tariffs on Indian goods in exchange for India halting Russian oil purchases and lowering trade barriers. While details are scarce, India is unlikely to open its agricultural market to US corn and soybeans due to its ban on GM crops and protection of small farmers.

articles.title: Trump Tariff cut: India’s textiles and leather set for US revival
articles.summary: Indian textile, apparel, and leather exporters expect a significant boost in US shipments. A new trade deal offers reduced tariffs, making Indian goods more competitive. This move is set to improve profit margins and revive export volumes. Small and medium exporters are particularly poised to benefit.

articles.title: RBI MPC begins rate meeting, decision due Friday
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India's Monetary Policy Committee has started discussions on interest rates. Experts anticipate a pause in rate cuts following the Union Budget and a trade deal. The RBI is expected to maintain the repo rate at 5.25 percent. The committee will announce its decision on Friday. Focus will be on liquidity management and market stability.

articles.title: Over 28 lakh households get Rs 16,000 Cr aid under PM Surya Ghar scheme
articles.summary: PM Surya Ghar: Muft Bijli Yojana has benefited over 28 lakh households by January 2026. Central financial assistance of Rs 16,061.12 crore has been disbursed. The scheme aims to install rooftop solar systems in one crore households. This initiative is expected to generate significant renewable electricity and reduce carbon emissions.

articles.title: India to ensure its record borrowing plan doesn't disturb markets, economic affairs secretary says
articles.summary: India will borrow a record amount in the upcoming fiscal year. The government plans to use bond switches and other tools to manage the market. This approach aims to keep borrowing costs competitive and avoid market disruption. Investor sentiment is expected to improve following the resolution of trade deal uncertainties. The rupee has also shown signs of appreciation.

articles.title: No tax risk for foreign companies setting up data centres in India under new Budget proposal: Finance Ministry sources
articles.summary: Foreign companies offering cloud services globally will benefit from a 20-year tax holiday. This incentive is available to those using MeitY-notified data centers in India. Overseas firms face no risk of their global income being taxed in India. The move aims to boost investment in Indian data centers and provide certainty to foreign cloud service providers.

articles.title: RBI’s first post-budget MPC meet opens amid India–US trade push
articles.summary: RBI MPC 2026: The Reserve Bank of India's Monetary Policy Committee meeting starts today. Top officials will discuss inflation and growth. The policy outcome is due Friday. This meeting follows a tech-focused budget and ongoing trade talks. The RBI has already lowered interest rates to support the economy. Markets await the decision on the next steps.

articles.title: RBI likely to hold repo rate, maintain neutral stance in upcoming MPC review: Nuvama Report
articles.summary: RBI Monetary Policy Committee 2026: The Reserve Bank of India is anticipated to hold its policy repo rate steady. A neutral stance is expected in the upcoming Monetary Policy Committee review. Past rate cuts are still impacting lending rates. The central bank will likely focus on liquidity management. This approach will be guided by domestic and global economic conditions.

articles.title: India services activity ticks up in January, PMI shows
articles.summary: India's services sector showed strong recovery in January. New business surged, reaching its fastest pace since November. This growth was fueled by enhanced online presence and marketing efforts. International demand also contributed significantly. However, job creation remained nearly unchanged. Input costs increased, leading to higher service charges. Business confidence for the future is on the rise.

articles.title: Gold and silver get cheaper to import as government cuts base prices
articles.summary: Gold and silver import prices have been reduced by India's government. This action lowers the customs duty on these precious metals. The move comes as global prices for gold and silver are near record highs. India is a major consumer of gold and the largest market for silver. The government typically revises these prices every two weeks.

articles.title: AI job fears trigger IT selloff; Unmesh Sharma sees opportunity for Indian IT, not doom
articles.summary: Indian technology stocks experienced a sharp decline following AI breakthroughs. However, an expert highlights that India's strength lies in AI implementation rather than core innovation. Electronics manufacturing services are identified as a multi-year growth sector. Investors are advised to navigate volatility with a focus on structural themes and disciplined positioning for future gains.

articles.title: 'US tariff cut may lift GDP by 20-30 bps', say economists
articles.summary: India's economy is set for a boost as the US lowers tariffs on Indian goods. This move is expected to increase India's GDP by 20-30 basis points next fiscal year. Key sectors like gems and jewellery, textiles, and marine products will see improved exports. The rupee is also likely to stabilize with increased foreign investment.

articles.title: Will this be the biggest IPO of the year so far?
articles.summary: India’s first unicorn plans a domestic listing with $4-5 bn valuation range; pre-IPO round and reverse flip underway, say sources

articles.title: Fitch revises Axis Bank outlook to positive, citing stronger sector environment
articles.summary: Fitch revised Axis Bank’s outlook to positive, citing stronger Indian banking conditions, improved asset quality, capital buffers and profitability, while affirming its BB+ rating long-term.

articles.title: India says it will buy oil where it makes sense, keeps Venezuela option open
articles.summary: India says it remains open to buying crude from Venezuela as part of its energy diversification push, stressing market viability, sanctions compliance and long-term supply security.

articles.title: Tanker Crash | Mumbai-Pune Expressway traffic chaos continues, tolls halted
articles.summary: Toll collection on Mumbai–Pune Expressway was suspended after a propylene gas tanker overturned near Adoshi tunnel yesterday (Feb 3) evening, causing a 12-hour traffic halt and major disruption in Raigad district.

articles.title: ‘Flooded with partnership requests’: Ambani on Reliance’s pull; Fink says India outpaces US in digitisation
articles.summary: Ambani was speaking to CNBC-TV18, sharing the stage with BlackRock chairman and CEO Larry Fink. The two are already partners—BlackRock, the world’s largest asset manager, and Jio launched a 50:50 joint venture in 2023 to build an asset management business in India

articles.title: India-US FTA: All the furore over inclusion of agriculture and dairy in the deal
articles.summary: India-US FTA announcement has sparked controversy as US officials flag zero tariffs on farm goods, Opposition and farmer unions protest, while government insists agriculture and dairy remain protected.

articles.title: RBI likely to stay on hold in February as trade deal improves macro comfort
articles.summary: Despite differing medium-term views, the Citizen MPC panel unanimously expects the RBI to keep the repo rate unchanged at the February 6 meeting, with Samiran Chakraborty indicating a dovish pause stance.

articles.title: On US India deal, Goyal says energy diversification paramount for India
articles.summary: Piyush Goyal stressed energy diversification and security for India, while US-India talks hint at expanding trade and reducing Russian oil reliance, but no formal commitments were announced.

articles.title: S&P Global-HSBC PMI: India’s services activity rebounds in January, jobs growth nearly flat
articles.summary: Rise in new export businesses helped push the growth with demands increasing from Indonesia, Qatar, Sri Lanka and Vietnam. As a result, the numbers expanded fastest since November.

articles.title: Budget 2026 | PSU bank mergers, capital rule changes on the table as India aims for bigger global banks: DFS Secretary
articles.summary: The Financial Services Secretary said the proposed Banking Committee for Viksit Bharat will have a wide mandate, including examining whether India’s regulatory capital framework needs greater flexibility and whether further public sector bank consolidation could help create globally competitive lenders.

articles.title: India's exports to get boost with US cutting tariff: FM Nirmala Sitharaman
articles.summary: US President Donald Trump's decision to slash tariffs on Indian goods to 18% augurs well for the country as it will boost exports, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said Tuesday.

articles.title: IRFC joins forces with Tuticorin port and Sagarmala Finance to boost big infrastructure projects
articles.summary: IRFC, VOCPA and SMFC signed an MoU to finance the Outer Harbour Development Project at Tuticorin Port, boosting multimodal infrastructure under Sagarmala and PM Gati Shakti plans.

articles.title: US Trade Representative Greer claims India agreed to zero tariffs on industrial goods
articles.summary: Speaking to CNBC International, US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said India has agreed to cut tariffs on most industrial goods to zero and lower duties on a wide range of agricultural products.

articles.title: India-US tariff cut to 18% is a big step forward, but execution at home will decide gains: Meera Shankar
articles.summary: The sharp tariff rollback offers India a stronger footing against several emerging market competitors in the US, but former envoy Meera Shankar cautions that the real gains will depend on how quickly India tackles domestic cost and logistics hurdles to convert the lower duty into sustained export momentum.

articles.title: With trade overhang gone, India Inc can plan investments better: Axis Bank’s Neelkanth Mishra
articles.summary: Neelkanth Mishra, Chief Economist, Axis Bank and Head-Global Research, Axis Capital said the agreement is a positive step but noted that global trade remains dynamic and subject to policy changes. He added that domestic economic factors and interest rate transmission will continue to play a key role in economic growth.

articles.title: Banking reforms panel to examine need for new banks, corporate entry: DFS Secretary M Nagaraju
articles.summary: Elaborating on the need for banks to have deep pockets in order to meet the Vikisit Bharat goals, the Secretary said exclusion of corporates from the banking space makes investments difficult.

articles.title: India could gain a stronger global footing through US, EU trade deals: BofA economist
articles.summary: India’s US imports could rise from $50 billion to $100 billion mainly through substitution from other partners, with carve-outs for sensitive sectors, says Rahul Bajoria, Head of India & ASEAN Economic Research, BofA Global Research

articles.title: India unlikely to fully stop Russian oil purchases, says former foreign secretary
articles.summary: Former Foreign Secretary Kanwal Sibal said agriculture concessions under trade deals are likely to remain limited, while global trade outcomes reflect negotiation pressure and strategic positioning.

articles.title: US trade deal done, fund managers now watch earnings and foreign flows
articles.summary: With inventories low in the US and positioning light in India, market veterans expect the deal to first lift exporters and large caps before broader sectors join in.

articles.title: India's tariff truce with the US may add enough to cover its education budget
articles.summary: There's a sharp increase in India's growth estimate post the tariff reduction. This has implications for the rupee, and by extension, to the monetary policy review due to start tomorrow.

articles.title: India-US FTA will see more exports of American farm products, claims US Agri Secy Brooke Rollins
articles.summary: US Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins's remarks hold importance as India has been firm in its stance to protect its agriculture and dairy sectors in trade discussions and deals with any country.

articles.title: Impact of AI on jobs is still unfolding, says CEA; assures of markets turnaround
articles.summary: Post-Budget 2026 | Chief Economic Adviser V Anantha Nageswaran said the labour market impact of AI is still at an early stage in India and globally; potential disruptions being addressed by focusing on skilling initiatives and jobs in sectors less likely to be affected by AI, such as allied healthcare economy, tourism, and the orange economy; cautioning that incentives alone cannot drive private capex and that the current state of global funk may continue for a few more years.

articles.title: CEA Nageswaran: India growth story intact despite valuation worries, global uncertainty
articles.summary: Chief Economic Adviser told CNBC-TV18 that FII outflows, US policy uncertainty and sector issues weigh on markets, but India’s growth story and fundamentals remain strong despite volatility.

articles.title: Budget 2026 signals stronger fiscal federalism as centre retains 41% tax devolution: Expenditure Secretary
articles.summary: Budget 2026 underlines sustained fiscal decentralisation, with the Centre keeping states’ tax share at 41% and sharply boosting funding for local bodies.

articles.title: Disinvestment mojo intact, ₹80,000 cr not scary, says DIPAM secy; more OFSs, QIPs ahead
articles.summary: The government has not lost its disinvestment momentum, is confident of meeting the ₹80,000-crore target, and expects more PSU OFSs and QIPs in FY26 and FY27, DIPAM Secretary Arunish Chawla said in conversation with CNBC-TV18 at a post-Budget event.

articles.title: Budget 2026: SEZ dispensation modalities being finalised, says CBIC Chairman Vivek Chaturvedi
articles.summary: Vivek Chaturvedi said the government’s latest customs and GST measures are designed to strengthen India’s competitiveness across strategic industries. From exemptions supporting clean energy and defence maintenance to export-focused relief for seafood and leather products, CBIC’s calibrated approach aims to balance domestic protection with global trade realities while reducing litigation and improving compliance certainty.

articles.title: Four FTAs, 30 countries: India eyes access to 60% of global market, says Commerce Secretary
articles.summary: A day after Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman tabled the Union Budget, Commerce Secretary Rajesh Agrawal said India is “in the midst of multiple negotiations” and is actively engaging with markets such as Israel, the GCC, Chile and the Eurasian Economic Union (EAEU). “Some of these deals may be finalised this year,” Agrawal told CNBC-TV18.

articles.title: Air India faces UK CAA scrutiny after Boeing 787 took off with suspected fuel switch fault
articles.summary: Air India has come under renewed regulatory scrutiny after the UK Civil Aviation Authority sought a full maintenance account and preventive action plan over a reported fuel control switch defect on a Boeing 787 Dreamliner. The airline says fleet-wide inspections have found no issues, but the regulator is demanding detailed assurances on continued airworthiness.

articles.title: AI is the new oil: Nations, not companies, are racing for global dominance
articles.summary: Hemant Mohapatra of Lightspeed Venture Partners says the global AI race is increasingly being shaped by national control over chips, data, and foundation models. As countries build their own AI ecosystems, India’s push for sovereignty through local data, domestic model-building, and semiconductor manufacturing could determine its place in the future AI order.

articles.title: Timken India Q3 net profit falls 30% despite 14% rise in revenue; margins contract
articles.summary: Shares of Timken India Ltd ended at ₹3,250.95, down by ₹2.50, or 0.077%, on the BSE.

articles.title: Bengaluru’s 4baseCare raises ₹90 crore to bring smarter, AI-powered cancer care to India and beyond
articles.summary: Bengaluru-based 4baseCare is ramping up its precision oncology ambitions by expanding hospital-linked genomics labs and scaling its AI-powered digital twin platform, Oncotwin, as it targets a sharp jump in revenues and a wider footprint across India and emerging global markets.

articles.title: Top stories: BlackRock chair flags ‘era of India’, Ambani’s big AI push, Goyal addresses US trade deal in Parliament & more
articles.summary: Top 10@10 - CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights - delivered at 10 pm.

articles.title: No more test runs: Gatik says driverless trucks are now a real, money-making business
articles.summary: Autonomous freight startup Gatik says driverless trucking has reached real commercial scale, with Fortune 50 retailers committing hundreds of millions of dollars to its services. CEO Gautam Narang highlights safety-led deployment, Nvidia-backed technology partnerships, and an aggressive fleet expansion plan that could see hundreds of fully driverless trucks on US roads by year-end, with India on its long-term radar.

articles.title: Coal India approves ₹3,190-cr investment in BCGCL; ₹3,133-cr equity infusion in JV with DVC
articles.summary: Coal India Ltd on February 4 approved a ₹3,189.54-crore equity investment in its subsidiary Bharat Coal Gasification and Chemicals Ltd to fund a 0.66 MTPA ammonium nitrate project. The company also granted in-principle approval for a ₹3,132.96 crore equity infusion in a joint venture with Damodar Valley Corporation for thermal and renewable power projects, with CIL and DVC holding 50% each.

articles.title: Air India clears Boeing 787 fuel control switches after precautionary checks
articles.summary: Air India completed checks on fuel control switches across its Boeing 787 fleet after a pilot observation, with regulators clearing systems and no issues found.

articles.title: Apollo Tyres Q3 net profit jumps 40%; revenue, margins grow; dividend of ₹3.50 declared
articles.summary: Interim dividend of ₹3.50 per equity share declared with record date set on February 10; capacity expansion announced at Andhra Pradesh plant. Shares of Apollo Tyres Ltd ended at ₹512.40, up by ₹7.45, or 1.48%, on the BSE.

articles.title: Maharashtra council panel summons comedian Kunal Kamra over remarks against Deputy CM Eknath Shinde
articles.summary: Kamra and Andhare were initially asked to appear before the panel at 2 pm on February 5. However, after both of them expressed their inability to attend, the hearing has now been rescheduled to February 17, the committee chairperson and BJP MLC Prasad Lad told PTI on Wednesday.

articles.title: Centre ‘attempting to silence’ Rahul Gandhi: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah
articles.summary: Stating that Rahul Gandhi raised legitimate questions on national security based on excerpts from 'Four Stars of Destiny', the book authored by Naravane, he said the book, originally slated for release in 2024, remains unpublished because it is "being withheld" by the Government of India.

articles.title: Karnataka excise 'scam': BJP MLAs mark overnight protest against 'ATM sarkar' with bhajans, sloganeering
articles.summary: The agitation, underway since Tuesday night, entered its second day with BJP legislators seen taking a morning walk inside the Assembly building.

articles.title: Heated exchange between Rahul and MoS Ravneet — From 'my traitor friend' to 'Desh ke dushman'
articles.summary: Rahul Gandhi called Ravneet Singh Bittu a traitor at Parliament during Congress protests over MM Naravane's memoir; eight MPs were suspended.

articles.title: Who is Nemcha Kipgen, a Kuki leader likely to be Deputy CM of Manipur
articles.summary: She represents the Kangpokpi Assembly constituency and also previously helmed several ministries in the state government.

articles.title: Who is Yumnam Khemchand Singh, the BJP MLA set to be Manipur's next CM
articles.summary: BJP MLA Yumnam Khemchand Singh is set to become Manipur Chief Minister, bringing legislative experience and a rare martial arts distinction.

articles.title: BJP 'mastermind' behind Sunetra Pawar's appointment as deputy CM, claims Saamana
articles.summary: The Opposition Shiv Sena (UBT) on Monday claimed the BJP leadership was the "mastermind" behind NCP leader Sunetra Pawar taking oath as Maharashtra deputy chief minister, just days after her husband Ajit Pawar's demise.

articles.title: National Statistics Office proposes migration survey in July 2026: All you need to know
articles.summary: NSO will conduct a Survey on Migration in July 2026-June 2027 to update data on migration patterns, with PLFS 2020–21 showing a 28.9 percent migration rate and strong gender differences.

articles.title: ‘What is scaring the government?’ asks Rahul Gandhi after Rajnath Singh, Amit Shah object over Doklam remarks
articles.summary: Rahul Gandhi cited unpublished memoirs of General MM Naravane on Doklam in Parliament, prompting Rajnath Singh to challenge the authenticity and request proof before Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla.

articles.title: YSRCP condemns rise in attacks on party leaders, terms it 'planned strategy' of Naidu govt
articles.summary: A group of people, believed to be TDP activists, raised slogans against Jogi Ramesh and Ambati Rambabu, alleging that they had made objectionable remarks against Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu and Minister Nara Lokesh. The group allegedly removed banners outside Ramesh's house, entered the premises, damaged furniture and glass panes, and set a portion of the house on fire.

articles.title: Budget 2026 sparks political debate over growth, investment, and fiscal strategy
articles.summary: Budget 2026 draws sharp political reactions as Manish Tewari, Lok Sabha MP from Congress, flags concerns over weak private investment, agriculture and fiscal stress, while GVL Narasimha Rao, former Rajya Sabha MP from BJP, defends the government’s growth strategy, capex push and macro stability, with implications for markets and long-term economic resilience.

articles.title: Maharashtra Cabinet rejig: Fadnavis to hold Finance; Sunetra Pawar gets Excise, Sports and Minority Affairs
articles.summary: Fadnavis is likely to present the Maharashtra annual budget. However, most of the groundwork for the budget had already been completed under Ajit Pawar’s supervision before his death. Sunetra Pawar was assigned Excise, Sports and Minorities Development portfolios.

articles.title: Sunetra Pawar takes oath as Maharashtra’s first woman Deputy CM
articles.summary: Sunetra Pawar became Maharashtra's first woman Deputy Chief Minister, succeeding late Ajit Pawar, at Lok Bhavan. She now faces key challenges in NCP unity and coalition politics.

articles.title: 'Not aware': Sharad Pawar on Sunetra Pawar’s oath-taking as Maharashtra Deputy CM
articles.summary: Sharad Pawar said he has "no information" about Sunetra Pawar, wife of Ajit Pawar, being sworn in as the next Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister.

articles.title: Meet Sunetra Pawar, Maharashtra’s first woman Deputy CM
articles.summary: Sunetra Pawar becomes Maharashtra’s first woman Deputy Chief Minister; know about her journey in politics, business, education and environment.

articles.title: After 8-hour jam, Pune industrialist takes helicopter as expressway stays shut 33 hours
articles.summary: Pune industrialist Sudhir Mehta took a helicopter after being stuck for hours on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway, where an overturned gas tanker halted traffic for over 30 hours, stranding thousands.

articles.title: Sharad Pawar holds two meetings with late Ajit Pawar's sons
articles.summary: Sharad Pawar met Parth and Jay Pawar in Baramati to discuss Vidya Pratishthan projects and possible NCP merger ahead of Zila Parishad polls. Ajit Pawar memorial was not discussed.

articles.title: PM Modi to visit Malaysia for talks on trade, energy and maritime security
articles.summary: During the visit, he will hold bilateral discussions with Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said, announcing his February 7 to 8 trip. Modi will also interact with members of the Indian community, as well as industry and business representatives, it said.

articles.title: ED cracks down on ₹658 crore fake ITC racket; searches across Bengal, Jharkhand and Manipur
articles.summary: Searches underway in Jharkhand, Manipur, Kolkata and other states by ED’s Itanagar zonal unit.

articles.title: Tamannaah Bhatia launches fine jewellery brand, opens Juhu flagship store
articles.summary: Actor Tamannaah Bhatia has launched Tamannaah Fine Jewellery in India, debuting everyday-wear gold and diamond pieces and opening her first flagship store in Mumbai’s Juhu using natural diamonds.

articles.title: Amit Shah to launch Bharat Taxi, India’s first ride-hailing cooperative
articles.summary: ‘Sarathi hi malik’ model aims to empower drivers with ownership, zero-commission rides, and enhanced social security; the platform operates on a surge-free pricing model, with direct profit distribution to drivers.

articles.title: Exclusive | AI is a once-in-a-century opportunity for India: Mukesh Ambani
articles.summary: Mukesh Ambani and Larry Fink believe India is uniquely positioned to lead the global AI revolution, with Reliance placing a major bet on the technology as the country’s next growth engine. From transforming education and healthcare to boosting productivity, AI could redefine India’s economic standing over the next two decades.

articles.title: Apple’s Xcode now supports Anthropic’s Claude Agent SDK: What it means
